p: Fig 1 shows the absolute trends in mean annual surface air temperature and mean annual total precipitation over the 20 th century based on Sen's slope b. In the map, and similar to IPCC [ 49], significant trends are highlighted at the 10% and at the 5% level; in the remainder of the paper, trends will be considered significant when a significance level of at least 10% is reached. This corresponds to very likely trends according to IPCC [ 49].
